page.title: 13LANGUAGE OF DEERNESS
page.content: Since the advent of radio and the influx of incomers into our midst many of our old words have disappeared but fortunately the{dialect}has in many cases remained unchanged. It follows no pattern or sequence. We live in {Dernis,}yet deer is deer and ness is ness. Loose is{louse}and a louse is a {loose.}Us is{is,}yet bus is bus. "I'm just going out to look for the duck and the goose. I'm going too to do two or three things." In dialect this is{"Am jeust gaan oot tae luck {fur the deuk an the geuse. Am gaan teu {tae deu twathree things." "Aa'll hae {tae git a per o' reed glivs tae match {me coolie"}means " I'll have to get a pair of red gloves to match my beret." {(eu pronounced as in French boeuf) Fool is{feul;}school is{skeul;}and it may appear to readers that we have never attended one.
